title: And the days fly by.

Â She sat with her head in her hands, or my favourite- pulled 24 water bottles out of the plastic into a big bucket and then dumped ice and shimmied each bottle around WHILE people were presenting and trying to talk!!! Â Not getting the hint after the 3rd "pardon me?" When we couldn't hear each other. Â I found it quite comical after awhile. Â After work each day dh and I had a cold drink, I replayed the childish antics and we laughed and laughed about her bizarre behaviour.Oooh lordy I need to find another position!What was good about it was briefly networking with others, and best of all was the full time pay :)The heat has been great. Â She recognized me instantly. Â I haven't seen her more than once in the last 28 years. Â She is still sweet to me. Â One of her sons and I are facebook friends, she doesn't talk to him because he's gay. Â I don't see that as a reason to not talk to your own child. Â Kid 3 has had the busiest summer of all, going with friends to their lake, sleepovers, camps, movies...it has been great!The wind is crazy now, maybe it will blow some smoke away so I can go outside? Â Hopefully.Enjoy the summer!!

title: Soaking Up Sunshine
text: This is not a financial post at all. Â This is a life and daily happenings ğŸ˜ŠÂ I had a very productive 2 week staycation. Â The yard looks great. Â New trees and shrubs planted, old dead branches trimmed and gone. Â The dh was very helpful. He did all of the backbreaking work. Â As we move along it becomes clear that we will stay in this house for at minimum 6 more years. Â The swingset was sold a couple of years ago, no need for a sandbox anymore. Â The basketball hoop and hockey net are the only "toys" that stay out now. Â Looking at putting in a firepit in the back yard now that kids "hang out" vs play.The trip to the west coast was put on hold. Â Making the yard a sanctuary that we like to hang out in every day used up some of that $$ and is a good personal return on investment! Many hours are spent relaxing and entertaining. A 10 day trip would have been a great adventure but that would mean that the yard improvements and house fixes wait another year. Â We mostly needed the hours at home to do the work. Some day when it isn't windy I will need a couple days for painting/staining projects. Â It should have been done last year but post-op I didn't feel like it! Â The house trim and the shed are looking very shabby.Dh and I booked an anniversary trip for fall. Â 3 months from now I hope to be relaxing in the mountains. Â Flights paid with airmiles, car rental from Costco and rooms with a professional association discount. Â Our first adult only vacation in 9 years! I've returned to physio. Â I think it's helping, hard to say what is injury vs. getting older. Â My GP gently talked to me about having a diagnosis of fibromyalgia. Â She knew I wouldn't take that well. Â I don't know how to process that yet. Â After my third day back to work yesterday I was so completely exhausted I went to bed at 6:10, stayed in bed until 9 this morning. Â My legs were cramping and aching, I had the bad "crawlies" sensation on my back that I get. Â I get a lot of weird stuff happening. Â No rash and fever which was unusual as it often is concurrent when I hit the wall like that. Â Part of the physio treatment is psychological too. Â It's a holistic place. Â I'm grieving and also downright pissed off that I can't do what I used to 8 years ago. Â I used to be a very decent athlete. Â I played every sport except basketball. Â Dh and I used to golf together. Â Sports is a huge part of my kids lives and I can't do anything except watch now. I miss playing catch, shooting pucks, diving in a pool and swimming laps, riding my mountain bike... Â I'm learning to meditate. Â It's hard to let go. Â It's hard to not be angry and sad. Â Serenity now! Â I can walk. Â I can downhill ski (only the green runs). I can snorkel with my flippers on. Â I win at mini golf. Â I sit on the deck and bask in the sun like an old cat. (Not for long because I'm a redhead- but it warms my aching bones). There will be nutritional counselling too at my holistic place. Â I haven't met with that person yet but I like lentils and quinoa and chia seeds! Â Maybe more of that. Â More kale. Â (The dh will not be enthused haha).This weekend is a birthday weekend for kid3. Not my baby anymore. Â The inlaws are here for a night. Â I'm not happy about it but will handle it for my kid. Â They let their thoughts about me be known last summer. I'm done sacrificing my time and energy for them. Â Trust me that they are vampires that suck the life out of me. Â That is one thing that has been very refreshing is being done catering to them all of the time. Â It was never appreciated. Â Thank god they don't live here!!!I'm going to enjoy my day off, drink my coffee in the sun, water my new trees and flowers. Â I wish I could upload pictures onto the blog to show my mango rose. Â It is beautiful, the moment I saw it, it reminded me of my grandma. Â She would love the color! Â I'm also going to mark out where I think a firepit should go. Â Dh will be so thrilled with my plans for him to dig!!The good things:Summer sunPopsiclesLillies and rosesThings that suck:People that are usersDecrepid body

title: Predicting the Future without a Crystal Ball
text: My last session at the bank was extremely productive. Â It was also eye opening about my pension plan, my current investments and my lifestyle and life expectancy.My pension plan kinda sucks. Â I need to work full time for at least 5 years to pull it higher. Â This is not feasible with my health. Â Unless of course I can find a way into another department. Â This position is currently very elusive. Â I had an opportunity to get in last year but at that time there was tremendous chaos in our family and I was teetering on the edge of a complete breakdown. Â (Someday, when the heartache isn't still so close, and on a different blog I will write about our experience.) So I ended up staying where I was and still am. Â It's not a fulfilling job. Â It's not a pleasant job most days, but brain numbing, and well paid! Â I also pick my own part time schedule. Â That part is fairly awesome! Â I'm able to go to all of kid3's sports and activities. Â My other 2 are both on their own now. Â Both working and one also going to school. Â I try to do a weekly meal with everyone so that kid3 doesn't feel like an only child!With my maxed out RRSP's and also TFSA's these will top up my pension and make it feasible to retire at 55! Â I won't be rich, but I will be able to live as comfortably as I am now! Â Including some travel every year. Â And according to my investment person at the bank I will live until I'm 90! Â So that is the withdrawal number he worked with. Â As my Grandma would say "That's too long to hang around". Â I may lower that number as time rolls along ğŸ˜‰ Â My dh has to work likely for 10-15 more years after I retire as he didn't start his current job and contributing to his pension plan until 10 years ago. Â He has reached the top of his pay scale, and with his last review he was put on track for succeeding the current director. Â This is great $$ but more travel and longer hours. Â Thus me being able to be around for kid3 makes more sense.As we know life can change in the blink of an eye. Â What the future holds and what you predict and hope are often very different. Â Dealing with change, coping with curve ballsÂ and staying grounded as the days go by is also a full time job. Â I love my little family. Â I tolerate my obnoxious parents and in laws, but I don't bust my ass to cater to them anymore. Â You can't fix or change stupid. Â Being used by them is tolerated no more. Â I've found some great very extended family that we mesh with very well. Â I identify with them, and so do my husband and kids. Â Same goes on dh's side of the family. Â He has a 3rd cousin and family that we are very close to. Â Normal, intelligent, fun and kind people. Â Always laughter and enjoyable times when spent together. Â Being able to break away from the tight clutches of my in-laws has given us opportunity to expand our circle as I don't have to cater to them every stinking weekend like I used to! Â Spending time with wonderful friends does the heart good. Â Such a relief to look forward to weekends!!Â Which reminds me -with days off this week I'm making a coffee date with a friend that retired a couple years ago. Â She makes me laugh with her dry wit! Â I've booked a pedicure, I'm going to try and get a massage too! Â Self care is an important part of life now too! Â And once or twice a year isn't going crazy with $$. Â The good things:My kidsThis beautiful hot weatherNo mortgage so that money is all going to retirementThings that suck:Getting a sunburn ğŸ˜Not winning the lottoNarcissistic parents

title: Investment Shuffling
text: For all of the financial moving and shaking I did yesterday I didn't pull ahead very far. Â It was a big shuffle that hopefully sees bigger gains. Â Over the last 2 years they have performed poorly but adding insult to injury was the money removed from the small gains that put me to 0. Â So over they went from another bank into CIBC "Premium Class" to pay less MER's and hopefully get some forward traction.With my eyes set on "freedom 55" I moved other funds around and topped up my woeful Tax free savings by 25k. Â Much more than the 15 I had planned. Â But I had the room to contribute and it makes sense to be making tax free gains vs. Sitting in my chequing account and I pay income tax on the pitiful $85/year I was making.The RESP (Registered Education Savings Plan) that I still have for kids #2 and 3 is doing well. Â To max out the government contribution you need to put $2500 in to get the $500. Â Kid #2 is too old to have contributions matched. Â But a guaranteed $500 return on $2500 is good in my mind and kid3 still has a few years left. Â I don't intend to pay for all secondary education, my oldest has about $10k in loans after 5 years, but is fully employed and can easily afford payments. My kid 2 is sorting out life and hasn't picked a path yet. Â So working full time. Â I also don't pay if they don't pass. Â I'm mean like that. Â Its very hard to nail down vacation time needed and kid3's activities and dh's vacation days. Â He is away for work for a week in 2 months and I will take vacation then as my hours of work are very early and kid3 has to be seen off to school. Â At work there might be a change in the office. Â I don't want to get my hopes up too much. Â It would help the stress level go down and satisfaction go up. Â But I remain pessimistic that there will be any forward thinking done by management. I haven't used my credit card for anything other than haircut and badly needed colour and some potion and spray to tame the frizzies. Â Staying the same weight also saves money on clothes! Â I am looking forward to warmer temperatures so I can pull out some different pants and tops and shoes. Â Even some ice melting would change the shoe situation. Â I had a locker that was mine for years taken away because I went part time. Â Now my coat is on a shared hook! Â Thank god nobody smokes.Here is hoping that St. Paddy brings in some warmth and sunshine!The good things:My kids all together last nightFeeling betterThings that suck:Not getting away for vacation for MarchMy parental units are loons

title: Dealing with Nonsense and I Need to Come Up With a Plan

title: What is new...
text: What is new?Everything, and nothing.I have been rolling along with my part time job. Â I work 3 days a week. Â For the last year that has been all that i can handle. Â I have been exhausted. Â Not just tired, but lay in bed, every muscle in my body aches, too tired to sit in a chair tired. My little one is great, loving school, busy with friends and sports. Â He did some camps over the summer that have made himÂ think he should be a veterinarian. Â And the Manager of the branch came to talk to me and thanked me for using their services.That's all for today, I have a ton of errands to run.Then get ready for Tricks and treats!Good things:Great kids$300 cashThings that suck:Changing banking information

title: "You Taught Him Well Mom"
text: Things are rolling along, forever changing.I continue to be a part-time employee, working 3 days a week. Â To be honest, some weeks thats all there is for me to do. Â As projects get completed there is a lull between that I sometimes have to hunt for things to do to keep busy. Â Not a bad thing, I'm not used to it is all.Kid 1 returned to the nest as finding out 2.5 months without a job makes it very difficult to pay rent. When he moved home, before he moved in we had a "Come to Jesus" meeting. Â I laid out expectations and conditions that I had, and if he couldn't live with them, he could live elsewhere.Turns out he did mature in the 8 months of living with a landlord and roommates. Â A much cleaner, neater and considerate version of himself. Â After a long job hunt he landed a decent $18.75 an hour for the rest of the summer. Â After 3 weeks, he's tanned, broken in his steel toed boots and put some callouses on his hands.His car however was a problem. Â Fully paid for, but killing him with repair bills every month and then it was something new each week! Â A piece of junk. Â I had bought him new tires in the fall (I could't sleep when the snow started, worried non-stop about him driving!). Then for Christmas a gift was a CAA membership so that he could get that stupid car towed to the garage when it quit on him.He's been looking for something else since March and this past weekend found a gem at a local dealership. Â Exactly what he wanted. For the last 5-6 years anytime I had kid expenses that the x had to split the cost with me, I put what he paid me into a separate account. Â So essentially I paid for the full amount and put his contribution into savings. Â I also added into it anything that the older 2 had to pay me back for. Â School amounts that were too big for the credit card, trips for kid 2 etc. Â I have built up this account to several thousand. Â Out of this account I helped with a substantial down payment. Â Then at the dealership my kid had to apply for a small loan. Â I was there to be a co-signer if necessary. Â The finance person was asking all of the regular questions about place of residence, existing monthly payments, then credit card. Â My kid has had a credit card for 3 years, they have upped his limit twice, but his card balance at the end of every month is ZERO. Â The finance man stopped writing and clarified if he used his card. Â "Yes, but I never buy more than I have cash on hand and I never carry a balance. Â My Mom said to never get into debt with a credit card"He looked at my son and told him that he never hears that from people his age, he is being very smart with his money.Because he has only been full time for less than a month, the finance person thought it wise to have my information available for the loan submission.The usual questions, then house value, then who holds your mortgage? Nobody."Wow, I don't hear that very often".In the end, he was accepted on his own credit information, mine not required. Â The handshake at the end of the deal was "You taught him well Mom"He ended up selling his old clunker privately the very next day for $1200 more than the dealer would give on trade. Â Then he kijiji'd other things he had laying around. Â Payments are covered for many months!The loan has no pre-payment penalties. Â He graduates from university next April, god willing there is a job waiting. Â At least he can drive himself to work with a reliable set of wheels!The good things: Â first day of summer!Sun shiningA little nest of pretty warblers off my deckFeeling more like my old self some days (after 5 years)Things that suck: Â some bugs ate every single leaf off my rose bush!

title: When Your World Turns Upsidedown
text: The last month has been spent trying to keep my head out of the water. Â I quit my job. Â Tried to go back to my previous one, my injury is too bad and I can't. Â I am working only half time. Â Fighting with insurance, fighting with administrators, my family in crisis, one of my kids in crisis.So when the bottom fell out I had to simplify things. Â Get a handle on income: Â use up vacation, OT and sick time. Â Get a handle on spending: Â stop automatic savings, stop spending.Because I'm kinda nutso about having a rediculous big balance in my chequing I haven't touched the Emergency fund. Â 15k if I need it.The monthly must pays:Property taxesUtilities: power, natural gas, water, phone*, cable*Car platesThe monthly variable:Food*Kid activities (swimming lessons, hockey)** = a portion of this is paid by the spouseMoney does not buy happiness, but it will buy some peace of mind that your basic needs will be met. My part time pay covers expenses - barely, often I dig into the previous excess in my account.I finally got in for counselling, she actually disputed that I am an asshole mom like I believe I am. Â I am doing many things right although I doubt myself. Â I'm still married, but bareley I think some days.You can only help yourself and you can only guide your children. Â At least my dog listens sometimes.Health breakdown is huge in a family. Â I have been the provider for the last 13 years. Â I physically can not do it now. Â There is no one that is willing to step up to the plate.I'm in a fortunate position in that I have zero debt, and have extensive savings. Â But there is not an infinite amount.My oldest is moving out, going to University for 2 more years, my middle staying put and trying to get into university, and my little one still in elementary and happy and loving life. Â Trying to not let any of this flying bs affect my little one.I don't have family support emotionally or financially. Â I don't even have a plan that goes past next week! Â Just trying to roll with the punches.There are more budget cuts ahead. Â I've been in way worse financial shape and managed to come out ok. title: I'm Downshifting this Life of Mine!
text: I have to start with the good news...I got the part time job that I bid for!Â  It will likely be a 3/4 time position which is perfect.Right now the start date isn't until Sept-Oct but I want to move that up to summer.Â  I am so tired that I can't focus most days.Â  It's just too much.It's about choices isn't it?Â  Choices that we make with our best - or not so best judgement.Â  Choices in what works best for us.I still want what's best for my kids, and they will get it.Â  I still want what's best for my dh and I and we will have it too.Â  If your wants don't exceed your income - you have it made really.My Mother in law was very annoyed or something when I told her I was reducing my hours.Â  She looked at me and said "Well where else are you going to work to makeÂ up the hours?"Â  When I said- nowhere, I'm going to try and get healthy and feel better, spend some time with my kids.Â  She shot her eyebrows up and pursed her lips.She has no idea that I have paid off my mortgage.Â  She has no idea that IÂ will have maxed out my RRSP's this year.Â  I have no intention of telling herÂ either.Â  My inlaws are lovely people but the more dh and I learn they are terrible with money.Â  They both have to work full time to pay for loans and a new mortgage.I also have an emergency fund. I call it "Crap Happens" and it makes me smile every time I take money out and put back in to read it on my bank statement.The dh's looser siblings have no issue hitting people up for money.Â  Then they go on a trip to Jamaica, buy clothes, Â remodel a kitchen.Â  Neither have a dime saved in the bank.Then there is my looser sibling.Â  So far in debt and denial it is laughable.Â  After scoffing at my clothes, home, cars for years.Â  The open ridicule that was given to me.Â  Now the shift is from pompous to panic as the debt skyrockets and the paycheque stays the same.Â  At least her family will look good in trendy clothes and shoesÂ when they repossess the house.Â  :)I have no urge to flaunt anything.Â  We enjoy our friends and the extended family that aren't a part of the drama and nonsense.My little one is done sports until the end of August!Â  Next weekend will be the first one at home since I don't know when!Â  I cannot wait to spend time in the yard and to get the bathroom remodel underway!The smell from all of the fruit trees blooming in my yard and the neighbourhood is heavenly!Â  I could sit outside all day!I am off to find something to eat for kid #3 and myself, and then off to swimming lessons.Â  (I don't count that as a sport- I call it a life necessity!)The Good Things...Having enough hours in to get one of the jobs I wantedMy dh and I have been working on our marriage for a long time now.Â  Things are much better.My older 2 are working hard at their jobs and maturing Things that suck...Don't judge me by the size of my paycheque.all of our siblings.ï»¿

title: March Blurb
text: I'ts been awhile now so I am throwing a quick post up.On the financial front things are happily rolling alongÂ well.Â  I finished my tax return and had my refund within 8 days!This year I made less money than the hubs. down from a pot a day!Â  I'm sleeping better and my heartburn is better too.Â  I can't give it up totally yet.....It is looking like spring is trying to come around and so when some more of the ice melts I can get out walking!Â  That should help the weight a bit and I need some fresh air every day.Â  Been cooped up all winter!Â  Today I have a list of errands that need to be done and I might do some shopping for kid #3 that needs some sweats and or jeans that reach his ankles!Â  His are all so snug and have holes in the knees!Â  He has been eating like a little horse and sleeping so much - having a growth spurt for sure.On my agenda today is also a trip to Target - lol!Â  See if I can find meÂ my sweet clerk for some coupons!Â  As one annon commenter (in a nice way) accused me that I was too hard on the clerk and if it was me I might be the same as the rude clerk.Â  Ummm nope!Â  It doesn't matter if you make $10 or $60 per hour you can still be courteous and civil when dealing with the public and if you don't know what to do or how to do it - title: Are my Coupons not good enough for you?!
text: I did a quick jaunt out to Target last night.Â  I had found some coupons in the Friday paper for things we needed.Â  As a rule I think that most coupons suck in Canada.Â  They are for junk and low value.Â  We are out of antiperspirant, shaving cream,Â mouthwash and shampoo and low and behold - a bunch of $2 off and 2 for 1 deals.So I am not a new couponer, when I was on mat leave 7 years ago I couponed in earnest.Â  You have to sign up and search and it takes effort to find good coupons here. (That's why I don't do it much now).Â  I know that it has to be exactly as stated to be valid so the right size etc...After finding clearance priced products that matched my coupons I happily go to the empty till.Â  There were 2 shampoo that had an "Instant Save $3", plus were onÂ clearance - so I thought I scored them for 99 cents...The woman at the till, unsmiling said something that I couldn't understand as a greeting.Â  (Or it could have been she told me where to go and how to get there)Â  I point to the save $3 now stickers on the 2 shampoo bottles and she peels them off and then proceeds to stare at the bottles and then stare at me, like I'm being sized up as the enemy.Â  After the inspection was finished she informs me "These expired Dec 31 - you can't use them".Â  "Fine" I say "Then I don't want to buy them".I splay my remaining coupons out like a fan in plain sightÂ as she rings through all of my finds.Â  I hold them up higher and say "I have coupons".Sour puss then scolds me (I assume as I don't speak whatever she mumbled).Â  Something about "Next time... don't you do blah blah blah"Â  She then, with more attention to detail than a CSI she scourers the coupons.Â  I bought 2 Degree deodorant - same size, same price but different scents.Â  She humphs and tells me they aren't the same.Â (again assuming whatÂ she said was something like that)Â I said that isn't a condition of the coupon.Â  Heavy sigh and she shuffles back to her manager that says - "Yes they are the same".Â  She shuffles back to the till scowling. (Huge pet peeve of mine - pick up your frickin' feet when you walk!)I had a solid 5 minutes of humphing and sighing and glaring to buy 13 things!!!Â  There was nobody behind me or I would have called a manager to help little miss nasty run her investigation.There was a "Tell us how we are doing" survey at the bottom of my receipt - so I did!Â  LOL!!So I think that I will now try to find a coupon and find that littleÂ twit to ring it inÂ every time I am near the store.Â  The poor woman needs my help to improveÂ and obviously likes to work hard on her investigative skills!!Â  I'm going to keep finding and "helping" her until she learns to give a proper greeting and enter in a coupon!Honestly Target: Epic Fail.On a good note - my family has no excuse to smell bad!Â  We are set for sweet smelling armpits and mouths for 6 months!

even with my reduced wage we split the bills in 1/2.Â  He does pay for the line of credit that the vehicles are on.Â  He could pay it off in its entirety today but he doesn't want to part with the cash.Â  His choice to pay the interest.My kid #1 got a full time job this summer.Â  (Yeah mom and the new resume!).Â  I helped with his cover letter tooÂ as his dad, my idiot x told him he could and should use the same oneÂ for all jobsÂ he applies for!?No, you need to be specific to the job you are applying for.Â  He had a "Group Interview" with 6 others and he got the job.Â  I was very proud of him.Â  He's a friendly nice kid and should do fine working at this place over the summer.As soon as we find out the plan for little #3 we are going to book a holiday or 2.Â  I have also had a talk with DH that IF our little guy needs the big surgery I will not work anymore.Â  I'll take a leave for as long as it takes for him to be fine again.Â  I had planned to go part time at the end of 2013 and we would be financially fine.Â  If I have to work 0 hours and care for my son full timeÂ we will be more than fine too.Â  I will just stop the big RRSP monthly buy I'm doing and reduce or stop the RESP.It really never gets easy does it?The Good Things...free $$ as far as I'm concernedWe have jobs that pay wellmy older 2 have good jobs for summerI am prepared to do what I need to do for my son's healthThings that suck...I would do anything to trade places with my little guynot loving your jobstress

And my dad "feels sorry" for my current dh because I have such anger towards my parents.Â  WTH?Anger takes energy and saps the life out of you.Â  I don't have extra to waste on them.Don't call me to fix things that go wrong in your livesÂ anymore.Â  Call the neighbours.Â Â When you are on your next trip (that you don't bother telling me that you are going on) and you have chest pain againÂ at 6 am on a Sunday.Â  Don't wake me up againÂ and have me arrange your medical care and insurance crapÂ from 1000 miles away when you're in another country. title: Getting Ready for Taxes
text: Thank you everyone that wished me well!Â  I really appreciate all of the support that I have here.Â  I have been so exhausted from work, and new meds that I am asleep by 8:30 every night.Â  Not much time to read or leave comments on others blogs.Â  This blog and the group that I read and follow have been a great source of ideas, commiserating,Â stress relief and humour!Last night dh and I plugged in some numbers to the tax program.Â  I don't have my T4 yet so there were a lot of guesses.Â  With me being off of work and getting paid by a third party, yet my employer pays me the third party funds...good grief!Â  It is one big ol' cluster of who paid what, income tax on what amount, pension, union dues...painful.Â  It looks like will be getting a refund because I didn't make a big wage like I have in years past.  In fact my salary dropped by $30k.  Every 2 weeks for the last year I have been grateful that I have had no mortgage money leaving my account.  We don't live an extravagant lifestyle, nor do we lack anything.Â  Slow and modest keeps you in the race!Speaking of pains, Jane I have an old version of something on this puter so I can't comment on your blog :(Â .Â  http://lifebeginsatretirement.blogspot.ca/Â Â  I tooÂ know C6 radiculopathy well, 14 months and counting...Â  I have aÂ bulging disk at C6-7 and 2 more lower down.Â  I fully endorse acupuncture and gentle physio (where she slowly lowers my 1st rib and stretches my neck out)Â  I've also started my 13th new med and this one seems to work with only a bit ofÂ drowsiness as a side effect.Â  Finally the ache in my arms is gone, fingers are still numb, neck still stiff but not like it was. I may start the juice thing!I did some work with my RRSP's.Â  There were some that I took out of the "high risk" mutual funds and had moved into a short term GIC a couple months ago.Â  They are due on Wed.Â  After phoning my bank 4 times over 2 days and never reaching a human being, just a difficult to understand voice message that was not left by someone with an understanding of English, I said screw it.Â  They, for some reason can't get back to me within 7 hours.Â  (Yes I am calling the real bank and not a call center in who-know-where.)Â Yet when you physicallyÂ go to this bank there are alwaysÂ employees standing around or jack-assing around behind the counter with no customers in the bank.Â  Nobody is smart enough to say "hello" and answer the phone when it rings.Â  Good-bye C!BC, Hello CWB.These guys answer the phone!Â A real person that talks to you!Â You can get in to meet with someoneÂ when it works for you!I've decided to keepÂ these RRSP's in a GIC for 2 years, now with CWB.Â  Yes, there is a $50 fee to transfer.Â  I will make it up with a better rate.Â  And they have a promo on now that you can "scratch and win" a rate increase.Â  I got an extra 1/4% on the posted rate.Â  Not huge, but better than nothing, and will more than pay the transfer fee.After plugging in my approximate tax numbers you get the little hints at the end.Â  Well it looks like I will carry over my RRSP contributionsÂ into next year.Â  It doesn't make tax sense to use them for 2012 with my wage soÂ low.Â  Now that I'm full time again (still lower than before b/c no overtime) I will use them for 2013.Â  The return that comes in will go towards the LOC that has the 2 vehicle's on it and some towards home improvements.Â  I am guessing that a new roof will be around 7k and doors ? maybe 2k.Â  Roof first, and worry about everything else after.What else is happening... Oh yes, I'm now old.Â  As declared by my 6 yr old!Â  I went to have my eyes checked as I do a lot of computer work now.Â  I need reading glasses.Â  I can still see to read quite well but after 4-5 hours of staring at the screen things start to blur!Â  I thankfully am fully covered by dh's insurance for the exam and the glasses.Â  I'm going to pick out a pair today as I could barely see from the drops they put in at the appointment.Â  Also taking the 3 kids to get there eyes checked too.Â  Kid #1 is 18 and is covered under the x's plan.Â  He needs new glasses (not that he will wear them!) grrrr! Â  Kid #2 and #3 are free exams because they are under 18.My Grandma is doing really really well since the bad episode at Christmas.Â  After taking her off of a crap-load of pills she was taking but didn't need, her mind is clear!Â She was a joy to talk to this weekend.Â  I love my Grandma and not just because she calls me "Such a clever and pretty girl"!Â  She is so happy that I'm working again and that dh has a job now.Â  She always prays for me and wants me to be healthy again andÂ happy and successful.What else is happening...Â Sharon has a new address now:Â  http://midlifemommusings.com/I will fix my sidebar...The Good Things...tax returns!CWBmedical insurance for pretty glasses for "an old mommy"my gramThings that suck...getting oldpains in various placesmy parental units

title: The Best of Plans...

title: Celebrating a Simple Christmas
text: Today I am getting some final touches done for Christmas.Â  The stocking stuffers are organized, the gifts are all wrapped and I'm making cookies and bread.I have to go into work tomorrow for 45 min.Â  My boss is so nice (not).My parental units will come tomorrow.Â  If history repeats (this will be the third time)Â they will arrive when the food is on the table.Â  So should the sibling and her 3 kids. So 5:30 is what I'm preparing for.Whatever.Â  My oldest has to work until 5 so it suits me.I'm pretty happy with the fact that I'm not overdoing it this year.Â  I've killed myself cleaning and baking and decorating for so many years and for what?Â  My kids like things simple, the dh's ocd can't handle the extra decorations and the mess and the parents are only here for a couple of hours and don't appreciate anything.Â  So this year is relaxed, I'm looking forward to quiet days of reading and kids around.Â  A couple batches of cookies that they love.Â  It's all good.This year I'm not stretching my money to the brink getting ready for the final mortgage pay down.Â  I have some in the bank and am more worried about savings and retirement funds and vacation funds.The mortgage freedom didn't bring a wild exciting new way to live.Â  It brought simple, calm and relaxed.Â  The pressure off of me has been a gift.I give thanks for that.Â  I am grateful for what I have.Â  I'm grateful for what I can give.2013 holds challenges of new jobs for both dh and I.Â  I am still working to recover from my injury.Â Â The blessing of being mortgage free has taken off so much stress.I hope that Christmas is a wonderful time for all of those that read here!

My little #3 is 6 years old.Â  This pastÂ October he told me about what they had practiced in school that day... "We did aÂ lock down Mommy".Â  The day before there had been a suspicious person seenÂ a couple of blocks from the school, police were called but no one ever found.Â  I cried later because I thought about what a sad world this is.Â How my little one, that is still my baby sweetheart is doing a lock down drill!Â His teacher had them all hide in the class, the door was locked,Â paper over the door window and blinds were drawn.Â  He said that his teacher cried when they asked what they should do if they were in the washroom and came back to find the door locked.Â  She told them where to go and hide.Â  She told them that she was going to protect them and keep them safe.They also started locking all but the front door of the school.  (Huge pain in the butt when it is -25 degrees and I have to walk the whole way around to get in)Â  I'm crying again thinking about it.Â  At the time I thought it was a case of over reacting by the school.Â  I thought that it was scaring the kids.Â  I mean really?!Â  This is Canada, I live in the suburbs, people need to relax.Know what?Â  I would rather that I froze to death than some wicked person slip in the side door.Â  I want my little one to know where to hide and be safe.Â  It's obscene and disgustingÂ what has become to this world.My heart aches for the children, families and teachers of Newtown.There is nothing else I have right now that matters.Â  Money and jobs are just that.Â  Money and jobs.I am blessed to have my little family that I love.

jacket...yep, that will make it all go away....I don't know how crappy her marriage has to get before she says "Enough".Â  Rock bottom is at a different level for every person.Â  Hers level is pretty darn low I tell ya!Â  I'm just sitting back and watching the carnage and it isn't pretty.Â  There are 3 kids being left by the wayside in all of this nonsense!I am hosting Christmas for the parents and the sibling.Â  She would be alone with the kids if I didn't.Â  It's been done to me (ignored at Christmas) but I won't reciprocate.Â  If I died tomorrow I would know that I chose to treat my family better than they have me and my children.Â  It's different now.Â  A giant emotional step back helps a lot.Â  I told my parents and sister what time, what is on the menu, what is expected of them (to bring) and thatÂ my own family of 5Â will be going to church service Christmas eve as we have done and enjoyed the last 3 years.Â  They can choose to join us or not.Â  My house, my family traditions.Â  It shouldn't be too much extra cost.Â  I have a big turkey that I was going to cook the 25th.Â  Now less leftovers is all.Â  Maybe I'll stuff the bird with Prozac so that we all get title: The Plan is: There is No Plan
text: I would like to have a plan.Â  I would like to know how much longer dh has his job.Â  I would like to know when my stupid neck and arm will feel better (if ever).Â  I would like to know if I can make plans for holidays, home improvements or if I will need that money to pay day to day bills.My savingsÂ are NOT burning a hole in my pocket but I would like a clue of what direction to take.I feel like I've been put on hold for almost a year.Â  Although I'm still making progress with savings and I'm making progress with my back injury so any movement forward is still progress for the good.I've been thinking a bit about going back to school.Â  Redonculous!Â  I'm 43!Â  I have 3 kids!Â  But hear me out...2 more years ofÂ University would put me at $120,000 a year.Â  I could get aÂ more brainsÂ less brawn job.Â  Something to ponder as I get the acupuncture needles stuck in my back and try to get the feeling back in my hand.....I can ride the bus to schoolÂ with my 18 year old!Â  Oh he'd love it!!! *snort*Education could be my ticket again to making my situation better.The Good Things...4 Wheel drive in a foot of snowA dh that shovels the drive again, and again and againHealthy kidsThings That Sucka foot of snowmy extended family

title: Good Bye Forever Mortgage!
text: This could be my last post about the mortgage. Ever!Yesterday in the mail came the discharge from land titles.Â  It only took 8 months.Â  Good thing I wasn't holding my breath!!It is done, finished, over, kaput.Â  Good bye and good riddance to that mortgage lender!!!I would like nothing more than for my name to be the only thing on that sheet of paper but, alas, there is a HELOC.Â  That was used for the car and SUV financing.I don't pay any money towards it, only the hubs does.Â  It was cheaper than dealer financing, and I was leery about being cash poor so I agreed.We didn't plan to purchase 2 vehicles in less than 4 months but crap happens.Â  A car accidentÂ could quite easily be argued a good use for emergency funds but I don't want to touch it.Â  With job uncertainty and health problems I want that money left where it is.When buying our cars neither were new, both will hold value as much as a car can, and I do not drive all over the province in winter in a beater.Â  "End of story" as my 6 yr old says.So I suck it up and share the title on my house with the TD bank.Â  There are worse things than having available credit.Â  It will be paid off inside of 3 years is the deadline the hubs put on himself and I'm OK with that.Last week my kid #2 had his dental surgery.Â  It was by a very lovely surgeon who treated my son and I with professionalism and TLC.Â  My son remembers nothing except sitting in the chair and then waking up in another room with my hubs and I with him.Â  Like a true teenage boy he was ready to eat that day and didn't stop since! Â I wentÂ through a lot of eggs and pudding and jello!He's almostÂ 75% back to normal with the bruising andÂ swelling.Â  I am so relieved that it is behindÂ him now.The cost was less than the original quote... only $2130.00Â  a real deal!Â  I've submitted to my insurance but still haven't heard anything.Â  I should by Monday or else I will have to call into the land of "Press 1 for English"Â  "Press 8 for wanting to scream and bang the phone against your own head"Life is otherwise finallyÂ nice and boring.Â  I have to go out and get some Halloween candy.Â  We get about 100-125 kids per year.Â  I like Kit Kats and Rockets - and soooo that's what I give out (in hopes of leftovers ;-))Tonight we are going out for dinner with a gift card that the hubs won golfing earlier this year.My savings are all automated these days, I treat them like bills and plan spending accordingly.Â  Payroll continues to screw with my paycheques so I think that there will be a big whopping payday in December as it takes them 4 months to rub their minds together and figure out where they screwed up.So I'm going to keep rolling along and try to avoid bumps in the road.Â  Maybe, just maybe, I can go on vacation sometime this winter?!Â  Meanwhile I will continue to pretend that hockey rinks are mini getaway'sÂ (ha ha ha)The Good Things....Healthy happy kidsI'm feeling betterThings that suck...I am freezing my tush off these days!

title: It's going to be a "Rainy Day" on Wednesday....
text: With my kid #2 that is the orthodontic challenge we learned on the last visit that he needs all the wisdom teeth out.Â  The lower ones are looking like they are "angry" and the uppers are heading sideways.Â  Early in life for a kid to need them out but whatever.Â  The orthodontist sent a letter to a dental surgeon (too complicated for a regular dentist) and we would wait to hear back.Â  Well if I don't get a call 2 weeks later and an appointment in less than a week.Â  I don't know about anyone else but around here to get a call and then get in to a specialist in less than 3 weeks is nothing short of a miracle.The caveat... $2300 due Wednesday morning.Â  No billing to the insurance company first, cash on the dash thank-you.I think that I should get $800 from my insurance and I will bill the x half of the $2300 so 1150 - 800 = 350 when the dust clears in a month or two.Â  But still need it up front.Luckily my credit card balance is 0.Â  I think and I hope that we are done with funerals for awhile.Â  This business of driving all day, come home, do laundry, repack and drive again wiped me right out last week.Â  $45 clothes for kid #3, $300 in gas, $130 hotel, $30 dry cleaning, $50 eating out.Â  Not in the agenda but what can you do?More than my wallet, my heart can't take anymore.Â  I don't know if I even ate 2000 calories all last week.Â  Grieving, the stress of my mother, my perfect idiotÂ sibling, so many people around (my family members funeral had 350 people)Â it was hard to handle.Â  We've made a point to have quiet family time at home.Â  I'm making our favorite roast tonight and a pie made this morning.Â  Comfort food for us.Â  The kids have all talked about the way they feel over the losses and I think they are doing well.Â  My little ones teachers are such caring and loving people.Â  They have given him lots of love and support over the last couple of weeks.The Good Things...My little familyWonderful teachersMoney in the rainy day fund so that I don't stress when things likeÂ this come upCarla's bread recipe that is now all my kids will eat! (hate store bought!)Things that suck...wisdom teetheven when your brain understands that everybody has to die someday, that ache that sits in your heart and the tears that roll regardless.
